intro: Onosma borragoidina, commonly known as the Persian bugloss, is a flowering plant native to the mountains of Central Asia. It belongs to the Boraginaceae family and is characterized by its hairy, glandular leaves and showy blue to purple flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils and thrives in dry, sunny environments. It has a compact, bushy growth habit and is often found in alpine or subalpine regions. Onosma borragoidina is valued for its ornamental appeal and has been used in traditional medicine in some regions.
